full_text: B ae TC Ered wie Els an IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2019/KERI35 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW THURSDAY, THE O3RD DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 13TH POUSHA, 1940 Cr1.MC.No. 4960 of 2018 CRIME NO. 1218/2016 OF Peringome Police Station, Kannur PETITIONERS: 1 A.T.V.DAMODARAN AGED 40 YEARS, S/O.CHANDRAN, EDAVARAMB P.O., CHERUPUZHA -670511, KANNUR DISTRICT. 2 RAJESH K. AGED 42 YEARS, S/O.DAMODARAN, KOOTHOOR HOSUE, EDAVARAMBA P.O., CHERUPUZHA - 670511, KANNUR DISTRICT. 3 K.D.AUGUSTINE AGED 61 YEARS, S/O.DEVASSYA, PULINGOME, P.O.CHUNDA, CHERUPUZHA, KANNUR DISTRICT. BY ADVS. SRI .M. SASTNDRAN SRI.P.K.SUBHASH RESPONDENTS: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM -682031. 2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER (CRIME NO.1218/2016 PERINGOME POLICE STATION, KANNUR DISTRICT, PIN-670001) . 3 JORDIN JOSEPH AGED 39 YEARS s/o. JOSEPH, KURICHITHANAM HOUSE, NARAMBU, KAKKAYINCHAL, VAYAKKARA AMSOM, PERINGOME, KANNUR DISTRICT 670001. BY ADV. SRI.S.R.SREEJITH B ae TC Ered wie Els anne Crl.MC.No. 4960 of 2018 2 2019/KERI35 SENOPR PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI M S BREEZ THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 03.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ieee Crl.MC.No. 4960 of 2018 3 201KERISS ORDER Petitioners are the accused in Crime No.1218 of 2016 of Peringome Police Station registered under Section 174 Cr.P.C. Third respondent is the informant. In the course of the investigation, the investigation officer reported that the investigation revealed commission of the offences under Sections 201, 306, 406 and 420 TPC. The accused allegedly abetted suicide of the father-in-law of the third respondent. It is submitted that the matter has been settled. The prayer is to quash the proceedings. 2. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the third respondent and the learned Public Prosecutor. 3. I have perused the affidavit filed by the third respondent who has entered appearance through counsel. I am satisfied that the matter ieee Crl.MC.No. 4960 of 2018 4 201KERISS has been settled. In Annexure AV Order this court took the view that the facts of the case do not attract the offences under Section 306 IPC. No public interest is involved in this case. There is no impediment for quashing the proceedings In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The proceedings in Crime No.1218 of 2016 of Peringome Police Station are quashed. The learned Magistrate is directed to dispose of material objects if any produced in this case. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE MC/03.01.19 B ae TC Ered wie Els anne Crl.MC.No. 4960 of 2018 5 2019/KERI35 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE A1- A CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO. 1218/2016 OF PERINGOME POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE AII- A TRUE COPY OF THE AGREEMENT ENTERED BETWEEN THE 2ND PETITIONER AND THE DECEASED. ANNEXURE AIII- A TRUE COPY OF THE PLAINT IN OS NO.33 OF 2016 ON THE FILE OF SUB COURT, PAYYANNUR. ANNEXURE AIV- A TRUE COPY OF THE WRITTEN STATEMENT FIELD BY THE 2ND PETITIONER IN OS. NO.33 OF 2016 ON THE FILE OF SUB COURT, PAYYANNUR.
